Lean Data

Lean Data Practices

Data Obesity


Just as unneeded calories leads to health consequences, the unthinking consumption of unneeded data leads to trust and risk consequences.

Lean data practices build strong brands

Increasing trust



Users are much less likely to use products and services they don’t trust. Once trust is lost it is hard and sometimes impossible to regain.

Reducing Risk



Every byte you store increases your operating costs and your breach and regulatory risk.

How?

Step One: Stay Lean

Do I need this data to provide my business or product?

  • If you don’t need a piece of data try not to collect it.
  • If you do need a piece of data, try to keep it for only as long as necessary and anonymize the data before you store it.

Step Two: Build In Security

Do I need this data to provide my business or product?

  • If you don’t need a piece of data try not to collect it.
  • If you do need a piece of data, try to keep it for only as long as necessary and anonymize the data before you store it.

Step Three: Engage Your Users

Do I need this data to provide my business or product?

  • If you don’t need a piece of data try not to collect it.
  • If you do need a piece of data, try to keep it for only as long as necessary and anonymize the data before you store it.
